tldr: In 1668, Gio. Domen Cassini observed a comet and its train of light extending from the Whale to Eridanus. He noted the comet's movement and the appearance of a new star near its path. The comet's tail reached about 32 degrees in length and seemed to tend towards the part opposite the Sun. The Italian and Portuguese accounts of the comet's observations are discussed, highlighting its great length and splendor.
